intro: Jatropha jurgensenii, commonly known as the Jurgensen's spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains toxic seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Jatropha jurgensenii is adapted to thrive in disturbed soils and can be found in various habitats such as roadsides and dry forests.
